io.leonis.torch.handlers

Interface MultiWindowListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUI.Listener
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MouseListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClickWindowHandler, CycleWindowHandler, MoveWindowHandler, StartDragHandler, StopDragHandler, WindowDragHandler

    public interface MultiWindowListener
extends com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUI.Listener
    The Interface MultiWindowListener. Extends the TextGUI.Listener interface to work for WindowBasedTextGUI.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean onUnhandledKeyStroke(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUI textGUI, com.googlecode.lanterna.input.KeyStroke keyStroke) 
      boolean onUnhandledKeyStroke(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.WindowBasedTextGUI textGUI, com.googlecode.lanterna.input.KeyStroke keyStroke)
      This method should be called when there was user input that wasn't handled by the GUI.

    • Method Detail

      • onUnhandledKeyStroke

        default boolean onUnhandledKeyStroke(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUI textGUI,
                                     com.googlecode.lanterna.input.KeyStroke keyStroke)
        Specified by:
        onUnhandledKeyStroke in interface com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.TextGUI.Listener

      • onUnhandledKeyStroke

        boolean onUnhandledKeyStroke(com.googlecode.lanterna.gui2.WindowBasedTextGUI textGUI,
                             com.googlecode.lanterna.input.KeyStroke keyStroke)
        This method should be called when there was user input that wasn't handled by the GUI. It will fire the onUnhandledKeyStroke(..) method on any registered listener.
        Parameters:
        textGUI - The WindowBasedTextGUI that received the WindowBasedTextGUI
        keyStroke - The KeyStroke that wasn't handled by the GUI
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the listeners handled the key stroke, this will signal to the GUI that it needs to be redrawn again.
